node.title: Groups urge community to 'spot the red flags' of family violence after lengthy sentencing of Matthew Davey
node.alt: Two police officers stand together - one of them writes on a notepad.
node.description: A group thatÂ supports victims of family violence says the lengthy prison sentence handed to a man convicted of abusing and attempting to kill his partner shows the justice system is evolving, but has also urged the community "to spot the red flags".
node.content:
["A group that supports victims of family violence says the lengthy jail sentence given to a Tasmanian man convicted of\u00a0attempting to kill his partner by burning her alive is a sign of shifting attitudes towards family violence.", "Matthew John Davey, 39,\u00a0was sentenced in the Supreme Court in Hobart on Friday to 18 years in prison\u00a0with a non-parole period of 12 years after being found guilty of attempted murder and\u00a0persistent family violence.", "During their relationship, the court was told Davey controlled and abused his younger girlfriend\u00a0and, when she told him she wanted to leave him in April 2017, he set her on fire.", "Handing down his sentence, Supreme Court Justice Michael Brett acknowledged the power imbalance and coercive nature of the relationship.", "He described the events of that day as the final step in an escalating pattern of violence.", "\"This case represents family violence of the most serious [order],\" Justice Brett\u00a0said.", "\"You treated her as your possession and,\u00a0when your ability to control her was strongly challenged, you [punished her]\u00a0and did so in a particularly cruel and arrogant way.\"", "\"Violence against women \u2026 must not, and will not, be tolerated in any circumstances.\u00a0All too often such violence results in death or serious injury of the woman concerned.\"\u00a0", "Davey's 18-year sentence is due, in large part, to the charge of attempted murder, but Women's Legal Service chief executive\u00a0Yvette Cehtel said what was significant about the case was the recognition of family violence and controlling behaviour leading up to the fire.", "", "
Yvette Cehtel says the community's tolerance for family violence has shifted it is now being reflected in the court system.\u00a0(ABC News: Manika Champ)
", "\"It's clearly in the public interest for these kinds of sentences to be known and discussed in the community, so that those [who]\u00a0are thinking about choosing to use violence to assert their power in relationships think twice about that,\" Ms Cehtel said.", "\"Responding in violent ways to things that you don't like is a choice. It is not people just 'losing it'.", "", "
Support groups say it is important to recognise family violence is\u00a0not necessarily one-off incidents and are that abuse is not always physical.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "\"This case demonstrates [the\u00a0fact], by recognising that ongoing pattern of coercive control in the relationship and persistent family violence.\"", "Ms Cehtel said the charge of persistent family violence, which Davey pleaded guilty to\u00a0after he was found guilty of attempted murder, was a particularly important step in understanding the reality of abuse.", "\"The Attorney-General, Elise Archer, needs to be recognised for demonstrating the leadership to bring that into law because it's important because it shows that family violence can be an ongoing pattern of behaviour,\" she said.", "", "
Hannah Clarke's parents hope an inquest into her death will help prevent\u00a0domestic violence tragedies.(Facebook)
", "High-profile cases \u2014\u00a0such as the murder of Hannah Clarke and her children\u00a0at the hands of her partner \u2014\u00a0have brought a greater understanding of the dangers of abusive, controlling relationships.\u00a0", "As community attitudes shift, so does the justice system, according to Engender Equality's Alina Thomas.", "\"[Davey's sentence]\u00a0really talks to the shift that we're seeing in better recognising family violence, better recognition for patterns of controlling behaviour and also that we're shifting the responsibility onto the people who use abusive behaviour for the abusive behaviour,\" Ms Thomas said.", "Engender Equality is\u00a0a not-for-profit group that\u00a0supports people affected by family and domestic violence.", "Ms Thomas said a sentence such as the one\u00a0Davey received sent\u00a0the message to victim-survivors that police and the justice system will listen and take them seriously.", "\"In recent years, we are seeing a greater sophistication in the police and justice response to family violence,\" she said.", "\"We are seeing abusive and controlling behaviour for what it is: that it is an indicator for escalating violence.", "", "
Alina Thomas says the lengthy sentence signals to victim survivors that family violence is being taken seriously.(ABC News)
", "\"In the community, intolerance for this is increasing and that's putting pressure on police and the justice system to continue to increase their awareness of what's happening.\"", "However, for those experiencing family violence, Ms Thomas said a high-profile case such as this one could also\u00a0cause concern.", "\"If this reflects their relationship, they worry they might be next,\" she said.", "\"If that's you, and you're in that situation, you need to be getting help.\u00a0You need to be accessing services and you need to be making sure that you have safety mechanisms in place.\"", "
'Be vigilant, speak up'
", "While society and its\u00a0laws are beginning to recognise coercive control and what it may lead to, Ms\u00a0Cehtel said there was still a long way to go.", "\"There's still a very real focus on physical forms of violence and what's very clear from [the Davey case]\u00a0was there was a long history of behaviour that actually wasn't OK\u00a0and threats and someone asserting their power over another person that was coercively controlling for a long period of time,\" she said.", "\"This is something Hannah Clark's parents have been very vocal about in realising the awareness of all types of family violence, including the non-physical type.", "\"As community members, we can all be more vigilant about that and speak up and support victim-survivors and help them to get away before there's an attempted murder charge or a death.\"", "Ideally, though, Ms Cehtel\u00a0said, it should be a wrap-around approach and every sector had\u00a0room to grow.", "\"We still have a lot of women presenting to our service who make those complaints to the police and nothing actually happens because there hasn't been a physical attack,\" she said.", "\"It only takes one physical episode for a person to die. That's played out in Australia with one woman losing their life on average a week.\""]
